intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis tetrachaeta, commonly known as the four-branched orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are usually elongated and arranged in a rosette pattern, aiding in water retention. Due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements, it is a popular choice for collectors and enthusiasts.
